DOC.brief_summary: Cross-linking of the cornea increases the mechanical and biochemical stability of the stromal tissue. The purpose of this study is to assess the effectiveness of riboflavin-ultraviolet light induced cross-linking of corneal collagen in improving visual acuity and reducing progression of keratoconus in the Brazilian population.
DOC.brief_title: Corneal Collagen Crosslinking With Riboflavin for Keratoconus Treatment: A Brazilian Study
DOC.criteria: Age from 18 to 35 years. Diagnosis of Keratoconus. Progression of Ametropia. Written informed consent. Corneal Thickness < 395 micra at thinnest point. Other active ocular disease than keratectasia. Cornea Guttata. Previous ocular surgery. Pregnancy. Known sensitivity to riboflavin.
